channel.title: Stress Fracture
channel.description: I had an injury last week in football, went to go see the trainer and so she had me go and see the orthopedic doctor to have a look at my foot. Nothing showed up on the X-Ray I had however he said that stress fractures don't show up for a few weeks typically. Another assumption he had was that it could be tendonitis IIRC as well. Either way it looks like I'm going to be out for a while... though I'm getting an MRI on monday to see what's up. Anyways, made this thread to ask you guys what kind of sports related injuries we've got going here...assuming some of you do play sports. :P

item.title: Stress Fracture
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

I play football, never been hurt though. Last game, on the 19th, my friend chuck got hurt. They took some X-Rays, and Saturday he was supposed to take an MRI. They believe he tore his ACL, MCL, and maybe his PCL. If I remember correctly, he tore his ACL sophomore year, and has to wear a knee brace now. He’s a monster on the line… We were watching film, and every single down he pancaked his assignment 10 yards from the line of scrimmage. We are going to miss him…

Read full topic

item.title: Stress Fracture
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Was speed skating (many people don’t consider this a sport) but I wiped out shortly after being clock’d a 35MPH. My right leg was really bad, but nothing serious to the point a little peroxide and time wouldn’t fix.

Anyways, before someone calls BS, someone in Michigan might remember the sports shop out in GLC (Great Lakes Crossing) back before it became a fitness shop (cant remember the name). They sold some decent wheels and bearings. Although during that time I had to order those ones online.

Read full topic

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:14, topic:411301”]Track. My heart rate went over 200BPM and I nearly passed out like 3 times. I had to sit out for a month. I beat you all imo :s

fuck my heart.[/quote]
Did you turn into hulk? :o

Uh… never broke anything… though i sprained my ankle a few times playing basketball :s

Read full topic

item.title: Stress Fracture
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:18, topic:411301”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=512566.msg3720453#msg3720453 date=1313896941]
Uhm… When I played Soccer, and Baseball I would have a lot of heart related problems and blood would start coming up and stuff, my heart would race too much and what not.

So Yeah.
[/quote]As in coughing up blood? That can’t be good ._. My heart just has a tendency to increase very quickly but decrease just as quickly. If I do a 200M sprint, I can go from ~100BPM (my average heart rate) straight to ~180BPM by the end of it (which is probably around 30 seconds for me, give or take 5). What happens to me usually is what follows:

180BPM: I get tired quicker if I continue other strenuous activities.
190BPM: I start to feel light headed and dizzy.
200BPM: Light-headedness increases, takes longer for me to regain stamina, start feeling a little weak.
215BPM+ : Light headed, headaches, can barely move, i shake a lot, and it takes me a long time for my heart rate to decrease back to 180BPM-, granted I have to be doing a stress test for this to happen, or i’m doing way too much way too quickly.[/quote]
Yes, cough of blood.
And I’ve never heard tested for that kind of thing, so I’m not sure, all I know is that I have trouble breathing when I start breathing hard because of like running as a base example, and I can’t breathe, blood starts coming up, I black-out etc., but I was diagnosed with Asthma (mild) for one, and there considering I have some kind of heart disease a long time ago because of my grandmother having some kind of rare heart-disease, I’m not sure on the details, I don’t pay much attention, I think they already diagnosed me with a heart-disease.

Read full topic
